text: The 2018 North Carolina FC season was the club's 12th season of existence. Until the 2017 season, the club was previously known as the Carolina RailHawks. The 2018 season was the clubs first in the USL, having left the NASL at the end of the 2017 season. For the first time since 2009 and its fourth in club history, North Carolina won the Southern Derby, a fan-based U.S. professional soccer cup competition between North Carolina, Charleston Battery, and Charlotte Independence. North Carolina finished the regular season in 9th place with 47 points, missing out on the playoffs by 2 points to Nashville. ==Club== ===Coaching staff=== {|class="wikitable" |- !Position !Staff |- |Head Coach || Colin Clarke |- |Assistant Coach || Dewan Bader |- |Assistant Coach || Greg Shields |- |Assistant Coach || Nic Platter |- |Assistant Coach || Michael Milazzo |- |Head Athletic Trainer || Shawn Wilson |- |} ===Roster=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! style="background:#01426A;
